title: Physical Science SP.7.a
prompt:
The Zeroth law of thermodynamics states that if two substances of different temperatures are brought together, heat will transfer from the warmer substance to the cooler substance.

With this in mind, if a room-temperature spoon is placed into a hot cup of coffee, followed by a teaspoon of cream from the refrigerator, how would the temperature for these three elements change over time?
feedback: Since heat will flow from warm substances to cooler substances, the heat from the coffee will transfer to the spoon and creamer. Having lost some of its heat, the coffee will get cooler. Eventually the creamer and spoon will be heated to the same temperature as the coffee, leaving nowhere cooler for the heat to travel except the air around the cup of coffee. This means that all three elements will eventually become the same temperature. This is called thermal equilibrium.
